title: Biden issues preemptive pardons for Trump critics and Biden family members
byline: President Joe Biden on Monday issued an extraordinary slate of preemptive pardons for prominent critics of President-elect Donald Trump and members of his own family, using executive prerogative as a shield against revenge by his incoming successor while also guaranteeing his closest relatives aren’t subject to future prosecutions.

title: Donald Trump sworn in as 47th US President in Capitol ceremony
byline: Donald Trump was sworn in as the 47th president of the United States on Monday, promising a “revolution of common sense” and taking charge as Republicans assume unified control of Washington and set out to reshape the country’s institutions.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Eastern, North-central and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts today (21), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: President to visit Middle East in Feb; Reveals future plans to export petroleum
byline: While highlighting plans to embark on an official visit to the Middle East in February, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake outlined that the discussions will aim to bolster Sri Lanka’s energy and economic sectors.

title: Govt to provide vehicles for all MPs; No more permits - Vijitha Herath
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath states that the government plans to provide vehicles for all 225 Members of Parliament in the near future.

title: Adverse weather impacts 15 districts, over 20,000 persons affected
byline: The prevailing adverse weather conditions have severely affected 15 districts across the island, displacing thousands and causing significant disruptions.

title: Trump signs executive order withdrawing from World Health Organization
byline: The United States will exit the World Health Organization, President Donald Trump said on Monday, saying the global health agency had mishandled the COVID-19 pandemic and other international health crises.

title: Trains delayed on coastal line
byline: The train services on the coastal line will experience delays, owing to damage to the railway track at Dehiwela, Sri Lanka Railways announced.

title: Lasith Malinga launches book titled ‘The Killer’ on the art of fast bowling
byline: Sri Lanka’s legendary fast bowler Lasith Malinga unveiled his maiden book, titled "The Killer", at a grand launch event held in Colombo yesterday afternoon (20).

title: MP Archchuna clashes with traffic police in A’pura
byline: The three-member special committee appointed to investigate into the allegations against Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna is scheduled to convene at the Parliament complex at 11.00 a.m. today (21).

title: Parliamentary session begins
byline: The Parliamentary session commenced at 09.30 a.m. today (January 21).

title: Lasith Malinga launches book titled ‘Killer’ on the art of fast bowling
byline: Sri Lanka’s legendary fast bowler Lasith Malinga unveiled his maiden book, titled "Killer", at a grand launch event held in Colombo yesterday afternoon (20).

title: NPP MPs’ allowances directed to common bank account for public service
byline: Deputy Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Sunil Watagala says that the allowances of all Members of Parliament (MPs) representing the National People’s Power (NPP) will be credited to a single bank account.

title: Colombo Fort railway station’s train timetable revised
byline: The timetable for trains operating from the Colombo Fort Railway Station has been revised.

title: Sri Lanka to hold first-ever conference of MPs with disabilities
byline: The Chief Observer of the European Union Election Observation Mission, Jose Ignacio Sanchez Amor, Member of the European Parliament, and his delegation met with Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne at Parliament recently.

title: After taking office, Trump pardons 1,500 Jan. 6 defendants
byline: Donald Trump pardoned about 1,500 of his supporters who attacked the U.S. Capitol four years ago as he moved swiftly to impose his will on the U.S. government just hours after reclaiming the presidency on Monday.

title: Police launch investigation into MP Archchuna’s clash with traffic cops
byline: Police have launched an investigation into the alleged altercation involving Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna and traffic police officers on duty in the Rambewa area of Anuradhapura this morning.

title: Govt. reviews ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefits programme
byline: The government has initiated a comprehensive review of the “Aswesuma” welfare benefits programme  to ensure inclusivity and fairness, Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Harshana Suriyapperuma said in Parliament today (21).

title: Sri Lanka to revisit IMF agreement?
byline: The government plans to revisit the International Monetary Fund (IMF) agreement to provide additional relief measures for the public, Deputy Minister of Finance Harshana Suriyapperuma said in Parliament today (21).

title: Govt will uphold existing Anti-Terrorism Bill until new law is passed: Minister
byline: Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Rathnayake states that the existing Anti-Terrorism Bill would be upheld with great caution until a new legislation is enacted.

title: Colombo HC postpones ‘Sathosa’ case against Johnston Fernando
byline: The Colombo High Court today (21) ordered that the case filed against former Minister Johnston Fernando and two others to be taken up on June 03 for further hearing of evidence.

title: Polonnaruwa-Manampitiya train service suspended
byline: The Railway Department has announced that the temporary train service between Polonnaruwa and Manampitiya has been suspended as of this morning (21).

title: Immigration officer arrested while accepting bribe
byline: An Immigration and Emigration Authorized Officer has been apprehended on Monday (20) for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs. 500,000 at the Welisara Detention Center.

title: World Bank assures financial and technical assistance for Sri Lanka’s key govt projects
byline: Vice President for South Asia at the World Bank Martin Raiser stated that the organization is committed to providing financial and technical assistance for Sri Lanka’s key government projects.

title: S&P SL20 crosses 5,000 and ASPI surpasses 16,500 for first time
byline: The indices of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) reached historic milestones today (January 21) as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 16,500-points mark and the S&P SL20 crossed 5,000 points for the first time in the capital market’s history.

title: Cabinet greenlights Proceeds of Crime Draft Bill
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to publish the Proceeds of Crime Draft Bill in the Government Gazette and subsequently, to submit it to the Parliament for its concurrence.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation drops to -2.0% in December 2024
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI) on Year-on-Year basis has decreased to -2.0% in December 2024, from -1.7% in November 2024, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Ex-Minister Manusha leaves CID after giving 6-hour statement
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) after recording a statement.

title: Kandy-Mahiyanganaya road section to be closed during the night
byline: The stretch of road near the 18 Hairpin Bends (18 Wanguwa) on the Kandy - Mahiyanganaya road will be temporarily closed for traffic near Kahatagolla from 6.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. daily until further notice.

title: Court order issued over MP Ramanathan Archchuna
byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court has ordered the police to act under existing laws with regard to Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna and to investigate the incident involving his alleged obstruction of police duties and traffic violations in Anuradhapura.

title: Army Major, 6 other ranks, policeman and 15 others arrested over recent organised crimes
byline: An Army Major, six other ranks, a policeman and 15 others allegedly engaged in organised crimes have been arrested over recently reported crimes, Minister of  Public Security Ananda Wijepala informs the Parliament today (21).

title: Turkish ski resort fire kills 66, forces guests to jump from windows
byline: A fire at a ski resort hotel in Turkey’s Bolu mountains killed 66 people on Tuesday and forced panicked guests to jump out of windows in the middle of the night.

title: 2025 Budget to engage every segment of population in economic process - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that this year’s budget will be prepared with the objective of involving every segment of the population in the country’s economic processes.

title: Suspect arrested with nearly 2 kg of ‘Ice’ in Hanwella
byline: Police have arrested a suspect along with nearly 2 kilograms of ‘Ice’ drugs (Crystal Methamphetamine) in the Niripola area of the Hanwella police division this afternoon (21).
